meanings.definition: To remove or undo the effects of colonization.
meanings.sent1: We must decolonize our history books to tell the true stories of all people.
meanings.sent2: The country worked hard to decolonize its laws and traditions after gaining independence.
meanings.sent3: The classroom decided to decolonize the outdated textbooks by adding diverse perspectives.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a map she needed to decolonize, erasing the false narratives imposed by others.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to decolonize their mindset, embracing equality and understanding.

meanings.definition: To free oneself or a group from colonial rule or influence.
meanings.sent1: The nation fought bravely to decolonize and gain independence from foreign powers.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to decolonize her thoughts and break free from the oppressive colonial mindset.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to decolonize their lunch menu by adding dishes from various cultures.
meanings.sent4: His heart yearned to decolonize from the chains of the past, seeking a future of freedom.
meanings.sent5: The movement aimed to decolonize the community, empowering individuals to reclaim their heritage.
